triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper surveys swarm robotics as its primary domain, categorizing behaviors and applications.

triples.name: Swarm intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper examines swarm intelligence principles underlying distributed multi-robot control systems.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics relies on multi-agent systems theory for distributed coordination and decision-making.

triples.name: Collective animal behavior
triples.relevance: The paper uses natural animal swarms (bees, birds, fish) as inspiration for robotic swarm behaviors.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: Navigation is identified as one of the four main categories of swarm behaviors in the survey.

triples.name: Decentralized decision-making
triples.relevance: Distributed decision-making without centralized control is a core principle of swarm robotics.

triples.name: Robotics simulator
triples.relevance: The paper identifies simulations as critical for testing swarm behaviors before real-world deployment.

triples.name: Robot locomotion
triples.relevance: Robot movement and spatial organization are fundamental behaviors explored in swarm robotics applications.
